page.title: 16Rural housing
page.content: Many of the larger houses in this area are farm houses, occupied by the farmer and his family. Some large houses were once rectories, village school houses, or farmhouses. The rectory at Acton Beauchamp is currently being altered to provide two self contained flats. Most of the houses are old, though some council houses have been built since the end of the second world war. With a few exceptions the houses are owner occupied.Several farms have caravan sites where people live on a permanent basis, while others have cottages for holiday letting.
